column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We luckily had no problem getting a table and were able to sit at a booth right away. First things first
column2: the menu all sounds DELISH. We had the hardest time deciding on what to try. Our lovely waitress recommended the Chicago Classic. A butter crust sausage pizza that they're well known for
column3: and we were not disappointed. That crust was hella buttery
column4: but equally hella tasty. The crushed tomatoes on top was the perfect balance to all the sausage and crust. Super thick
column5: the definition of a Chicago deep dish. Absolutely would get this again.
